tips.title: Prenatal Care Essentials
tips.content: Regular prenatal check-ups are crucial for both mother and baby's health. Visit your healthcare provider monthly during the first 7 months, twice monthly during the 8th month, and weekly during the 9th month.
tips.shortContent: Regular prenatal check-ups are crucial for both mother and baby's health.

tips.title: Nutrition During Pregnancy
tips.content: Eat a balanced diet rich in iron, folic acid, calcium, and protein. Include green leafy vegetables, fruits, dairy products, and lean meats. Take prescribed supplements as recommended by your doctor.
tips.shortContent: Eat a balanced diet rich in iron, folic acid, calcium, and protein.

tips.title: Warning Signs During Pregnancy
tips.content: Seek immediate medical attention if you experience severe headaches, blurred vision, severe abdominal pain, vaginal bleeding, or sudden swelling of hands and face.
tips.shortContent: Seek immediate medical attention for severe headaches, blurred vision, or vaginal bleeding.

tips.title: Childhood Vaccination Schedule
tips.content: Follow the national immunization schedule: BCG at birth, OPV at birth and 6, 10, 14 weeks, DPT at 6, 10, 14 weeks, Measles at 9 months, and MMR at 15 months. Keep vaccination records safe.
tips.shortContent: Follow the national immunization schedule and keep vaccination records safe.

tips.title: Importance of Vaccination
tips.content: Vaccines protect children from serious diseases like polio, measles, tetanus, and whooping cough. Vaccination is safe, effective, and free at government health centers.
tips.shortContent: Vaccines protect children from serious diseases and are safe and effective.

tips.title: Side Effects of Vaccination
tips.content: Mild side effects like fever, redness, or swelling at injection site are normal. Contact your healthcare provider if symptoms persist or worsen.
tips.shortContent: Mild side effects like fever or redness are normal after vaccination.

tips.title: Breastfeeding Benefits
tips.content: Breast milk provides complete nutrition for babies up to 6 months. It contains antibodies that protect against infections and promotes healthy growth and development.
tips.shortContent: Breast milk provides complete nutrition and protects against infections.

tips.title: Complementary Feeding
tips.content: Start complementary feeding at 6 months while continuing breastfeeding. Begin with soft, mashed foods like rice, dal, and vegetables. Gradually increase variety and texture.
tips.shortContent: Start complementary feeding at 6 months with soft, mashed foods.

tips.title: Iron Deficiency Prevention
tips.content: Include iron-rich foods like green leafy vegetables, jaggery, dates, and meat in your diet. Take iron supplements as prescribed by your doctor to prevent anemia.
tips.shortContent: Include iron-rich foods and take supplements to prevent anemia.

tips.title: Hand Hygiene
tips.content: Wash hands with soap and water for at least 20 seconds before eating, after using toilet, and after handling waste. This prevents the spread of infections.
tips.shortContent: Wash hands with soap and water for at least 20 seconds to prevent infections.

tips.title: Safe Water and Sanitation
tips.content: Drink only boiled or filtered water. Use clean toilets and maintain proper sanitation. This prevents waterborne diseases like diarrhea and cholera.
tips.shortContent: Drink only boiled or filtered water and maintain proper sanitation.

tips.title: Mosquito Prevention
tips.content: Use mosquito nets while sleeping, wear long-sleeved clothes, and eliminate standing water around your home to prevent malaria and dengue.
tips.shortContent: Use mosquito nets and eliminate standing water to prevent malaria and dengue.

tips.title: Regular Health Check-ups
tips.content: Visit your healthcare provider regularly for check-ups, even when you feel healthy. Early detection of health problems leads to better treatment outcomes.
tips.shortContent: Visit your healthcare provider regularly for check-ups, even when healthy.

tips.title: Mental Health Awareness
tips.content: Mental health is as important as physical health. Talk to someone if you feel sad, anxious, or overwhelmed. Seek professional help when needed.
tips.shortContent: Mental health is important. Talk to someone if you feel sad or anxious.

tips.title: Exercise and Physical Activity
tips.content: Engage in regular physical activity like walking, yoga, or household work. Exercise improves physical and mental health and helps prevent chronic diseases.
tips.shortContent: Engage in regular physical activity to improve health and prevent diseases.
